content.3: Oh that I knew where I might find him!

content.7: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
content.8: Behold, I go forward, but he
content.9: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold
content.10: But he knoweth the way that I take:
content.11: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
content.12: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary
content.15: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
content.16: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
content.17: Because I was not cut off before the darkness,
